brief_summary.textblock:
Does having a large diameter metal on polyethylene total hip replacement increase metal ion
      release. Larger metal heads are thought to have increased torsional forces on the trunion
      which would like release more metal ions. Increased metal ion levels have been associated
      with adverse local tissue reactions. Are there any differences comparing these groups to a
      dual mobility type total hip replacement.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of Large Diameter Metal Heads vs. Small Diameter Metal Heads vs/ Dual Mobility Total Hip Replacements

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  One total hip replacement, either a large metal head (>40) or a small metal head
             (<30) on a polyethylene bearing surface.

          -  2 to 5 years s/p surgery minimum. No symptoms

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Any other bearing surface besides metal on poly, no other joint replacements,
             symptomatic

study_pop.textblock: Orthopedic patients with prior hip replacement.

clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of Large Diameter Metal Heads vs. Small Diameter Metal Heads vs/ Dual Mobility Total Hip Replacements

primary_outcome.description: We would like to determine a difference in metal ion levels on metal on polyethylene total hip replacement

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
